thread.title: Playoff picture for area football teams
thread.title_full: Playoff picture for area football teams

title: Playoff picture for area football teams
text:
Playoff picture for area football teams 10:49 PM, Oct 22, 2015 Copyright 2015 Journal Media Group. All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten, or redistributed. Show Caption Next 
Football playoff scenarios 
Two weeks remain in the high school football season. Here's an early look at this year's playoff possibilities: 
Region 1-6A 
*Moving On: Maryville, Bearden, Hardin Valley, Jefferson County, William Blount, Dobyns-Bennett, Science Hill, Bradley Central 
What's at Stake: Maryville clinches top seed in the region with a win over either Bradley Central on Friday or Hardin Valley on Oct. 30 or a Science Hill loss. â€¦ Bearden is assured the No. 2 seed in the region if it beats Science Hill and Jefferson County, but earns at least a first-round home playoff game with a win over either team and a Bradley Central or HVA loss. ... HVA will be no worse than a No. 6 seed with a win over William Blount, and can earn a No. 5 seed with a win and two Dobyns-Bennett losses. ... Jefferson County likely is a No. 7 seed unless it upsets either Dobyns-Bennett or Bearden. ... William Blount is assured the No. 8 seed with a loss to Hardin Valley or Bradley Central. 
*All Class 6A teams advance to playoffs. 
Region 1-5A 
Moving On: Sevier County, Morristown West, Tennessee High 
On the Bubble: Morristown East, Cocke County 
Staying Home: #Daniel Boone, #David Crockett 
What's at Stake: Sevier County clinched a regular-season region title by beating Morristown West on Thursday. Morristown East and Cocke County will play for the region's final playoff spot next Friday. 
#Ineligible for playoffs 
Moving On: West, Heritage, Halls, Gibbs 
Staying Home: South-Doyle, Powell 
What's at Stake: West has clinched the top seed in the region, and Heritage and Halls will play for the No. 2 seed during their regular-season finale next Friday. Gibbs will be the No. 4 seed. 
Region 3-5A 
Moving On: Farragut, Oak Ridge, Campbell County, Clinton 
Staying Home: Lenoir City, Karns 
What's at Stake: Campbell County and Oak Ridge will play for a No. 2 seed on Oct. 30. Farragut has clinched the top spot in the region, and Clinton will be the No. 4 seed. 
Region 1-4A 
On the Bubble: Sullivan East, Cherokee, Sullivan South, Grainger 
Staying Home: Volunteer, Sullivan Central 
What's at Stake: Greeneville clinches a region title with a win and a Seymour loss. Grainger clinches a playoff berth with wins over Cherokee and Sullivan South. 
Region 2-4A 
Moving On: Fulton, Central, Catholic 
On the Bubble: Carter, Anderson County 
Staying Home: Union County 
What's at Stake: Fulton and Central will play for a region title in their season finale on Oct. 30. Anderson County and Carter will play for the region's final playoff spot on the same day. Catholic is the No. 3 seed. 
Region 3-4A 
Moving On: Stone Memorial, East Hamilton, Livingston Academy 
On the Bubble: Cumberland County, Hixson 
Staying Home: Sequoyah, Chattanooga Central 
What's at Stake: Cumberland County clinches the region's No. 4 seed with a win over either Stone Memorial or Chattanooga Central during the next two weeks or a Hixson loss to Livingston Academy. 
Region 1-3A 
Moving On: Elizabethton, Pigeon Forge 
On the Bubble: Northview Academy, Chuckey-Doak, Unicoi, Johnson County 
Staying Home: Claiborne, West Greene 
What's at Stake: Elizabethton can win the region on Friday by beating Chuckey-Doak, which is eliminated with a loss. Pigeon Forge clinches the No. 2 seed with a win over Johnson County. Northview will advance to the playoffs with a win over Unicoi. 
Region 2-3A 
Moving On: Alcoa, Christian Academy of Knoxville, Kingston 
On the Bubble: Scott, McMinn Central 
Staying Home: Loudon 
What's at Stake: Alcoa and CAK will play for a region title on Oct. 29. The winner of the Scott-McMinn Central game on Friday clinches the region's final playoff spot. Kingston is the No. 3 seed. 
Region 2-2A 
Moving On: Grace Christian, Rockwood 
On the Bubble: Austin-East, Sweetwater, Tellico Plains 
Staying Home: Wartburg, Oliver Springs 
What's at Stake: Grace Christian clinches a region title with a win over Tellico Plains and an Austin-East loss. The Rams play the Roadrunners next Friday. ... Sweetwater can clinch the No. 3 seed with a win over Austin-East. ... Rockwood wins the region if it wins its final two games and Austin-East beats Sweetwater and Grace Christian. ... Tellico Plains, with games left against Grace and Rockwood, needs to pair two wins with a Sweetwater loss or two Rockwood losses or two Austin-East losses to make the playoffs. 
Region 1-1A 
Moving On: Cloudland, Oakdale, Hancock County, Unaka 
Staying Home: Concord Christian 
What's At Stake: Cloudland has clinched the region's No. 1 seed, and Oakdale will be No. 2. Friday's Hancock County-Unaka game will determine the final two seeds. 
Region 2-1A 
Staying Home: Jellico, Midway 
On The Bubble: Oneida, Coalfield, Sunbright 
What's At Stake: Greenback and Harriman will play for a region title on Friday. Coalfield clinches a playoff berth and eliminates Sunbright with a win over Jellico. If that happens, the Yellow Jackets will play Oneida for the No. 3 seed next Friday. 
East/Middle Region District I 
Moving On: Friendship Christian, Donelson Christian, Webb, The King's Academy 
Staying Home: Mt. Juliet Christian 
What's At Stake: Webb wins the region with a win over The King's Academy next Friday and a Donelson Christian loss to Mt. Juliet. Friendship Christian will be the No. 1 seed if it wins its final two games and DCA beats Mt. Juliet or Webb loses to TKA. If the latter happens, TKA will be the No. 3 seed as long as DCA wins its region finale. 
Chris Thomas Copyright 2015 Journal Media Group. All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten, or redistributed.
